item.title: Project 2: Metacritic User Rating Prediction
item.description: Why it matters? Oftentimes, you see a bad review of a movie from critics and think that you won’t enjoy the movie. However, when you go to a theater and watch the movie for yourself, you find out you actually enjoy the movie more than you thought. This happened to me when I watched Extraction 2, Transformers: Rise of the Beasts, and Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3. The opposite situation also happened, and sometimes, critic ratings are similar to user ratings such as Fast X and John Wick 4.

item.title: Project 1: San Diego Collision EDA
item.description: Why it matters? In Korea, car navigation systems notify drivers when they enter ‘accident-prone areas,’ helping them stay alert and avoid potential accidents. However, similar services are not commonly available in navigation systems in the US. As a result, I became curious about identifying accident-prone areas in San Diego to raise awareness when I drive in the future. Moreover, as an inexperienced driver, I have been told lane changes are the most challenging task when driving in Korea, partly due to narrow lanes.

item.title: About
item.description: Hello. I’m SangGyu An, who is passionate about learning and solving problems with data. With a major in Data Science at UC San Diego, I’m continuously seeking to expand my horizons and stay at the forefront of this rapidly evolving field. As a firm believer in the power of data, I am dedicated to uncovering meaningful insights and translating them into actionable solutions. My portfolio showcases a collection of projects where Iâ€™ve harnessed data to tackle a variety of challenges, ranging from San Diego Collision EDA to MetaCritic User Rating prediction.
